item.title: Ephemeral Kubernetes Lab with IaC and GitOps
item.description: I’ve been thinking of moving my Kubernetes lab into the cloud, but with cloud resource usage being scrutinized by the IT department, running them 24x7 the way I’m used to is a no-go. I need a setup that meets the following requirements: Simple to create and tear down Applications must be pre-deployed when the cluster is up, as close to “just the way I left it there last night” as possible cost $0 when the setup has been switched off I eventually settled on the idea of an ephemeral Kubernetes lab environment using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and GitOps practices, which I will cover in this post.

item.title: Learning Terraform S3 Backend
item.description: I have had basic experience playing with Terraform to instantiate resources in Kubernetes and AWS, but my previous attempts left me with a thought, how do I implement this at work and scale it up to the team? Terraform creates a local state file which seems like a pain to share around a team. This is when I found out about remote backends. And this is my attempt to learn Terraform S3 backend.
